intro: Clutia abyssinica, commonly known as Abyssinian clutia, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and elliptical leaves. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its flowers are usually white or pale pink, and it produces small, three-lobed fruits. Clutia abyssinica is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forest understories and along riverbanks.
